question:
For which values of $a\in\mathbb{R}$ the following linear system has infinitely many solutions?
$$\left\{\begin{array}{cccccccc}
x & + & ay & + & 2z & = & 5\\
ax & - & y & - & z & = & 1\\
x &  + &  ay & + & z & = & 3
\end{array}\right.$$
answer1: There is no $a\in\mathbb{R}$ for which the system has infinitely many solutions.
answer4: For every $a\in\mathbb{R}$ the system has infinitely many solutions.

question:
Ralph Edmund loves steaks and potatoes. Therefore, he has decided to go on a steady diet of only these two foods (plus some liquids and vitamin supplements) for all his meals. Ralph realizes that this isn't the healthiest diet, so he wants to make sure that he eats the right quantities of the two foods to satisfy some key nutritional requirements. He has obtained the following nutritional and cost information:

\[
\begin{array}{|l|c|c|c|}
\hline
%& \multicolumn{2}{c|}{Grams of ingredient per serving} &\\
\text{Ingredient} & \text{Steak (gr. per serving)} & \text{Potatoes (gr. per serving)} & \text{Daily Requirements (gr.)} \\
\hline
\text{Carbohydrates} & 5 & 15 & \geq 50 \\
\text{Protein} & 20 & 5 & \geq 40 \\
\text{Fat} & 15 & 2 & \leq 60 \\
\hline
\text{Cost per serving} & 4 & 2 &  \\
\hline
\end{array}
\]

In this situation, what are the decision variables to formalize the Linear Programming (LP) model that allows planning the Ralph's diet?
answer1: $x_{i}$ is the number of daily servings of food $i$ ($i=1$, for steak and $i=2$, for potatoes)
answer2: $x$ is the number of daily servings of food
answer3: $x_{1}$ is the number of daily servings of potatoes
answer4: $x_{2}$ is the number of daily servings of steak

question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
2x & + & y & - & 4z & = & 0 \\
-x & + & y & + & z & = & 0 \\
x & + & 5y & - & 5z & = & 0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The solutions of the system are $\left(\frac{5}{2}y,\,y,\,\frac{3}{2}y\right)$ for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(5,2,3\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(0,\,0,\,0\right)$ as its unique solution.

question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & y & - & 3z & + & 2t & = & 1 \\
2x & - & y & - & z & + & t & = & 0 \\
x & + & y & + & z & - & t & = & -2
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The solutions of the system are of the form $\bigg(-\frac{2}{3},\frac{1}{4}t-\frac{7}{12},\frac{3}{4}t-\frac{3}{4},t\bigg)$, for all $t\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\bigg(-\frac{2}{3},-\frac{7}{12},-\frac{3}{4},0\bigg)$ as unique solution.
answer4: The solution of the system is the vector of coordinates $(2,-1,0,0)$.

$$\begin{cases}
2x &  &  &+ &4z &= &0 \\ 
3x &- &4y &+ &12z &= &0 \\ 
x &- &2y &+ &5z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(-2z,\,\frac{3z}{2},\,z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(-4,3,2\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(-2z+y,y,z\right)$ as solution for every $y,z\in\mathbb{R}$.

 1  & 1  & 0 \\

\end{array}\right]$$
and denote by $L(A_k)$ the space of the rows of the matrix $A_k$. Which of the following statements is true?

answer2: The dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$ for every $k\in \mathbb{R}$

question:
For every $m\in\mathbb{R}$, consider the line $r$ of equation $x+my=-3$ and the line $s$ of equation $mx+4y=6$.
Describe the mutual position of $r$ and $s$ with respect to the value of $m$.
answer1: The lines $r$ and $s$ are equal if $m=-2$, parallel if $m=2$, and secant otherwise.
answer2: The lines $r$ and $s$ are equal if $m=2$, parallel if $m=-2$, and secant otherwise.
answer3: The lines $r$ and $s$ are secant for every $m$.
answer4: The lines $r$ and $s$ are parallel for every $m$.

$$\begin{cases}
&x_1 &- &x_2 &- &3x_3 &+ &4x_4 &= &1 \\
&x_1 &+ &x_2 &+ &x_3 &+ &2x_4 &= &-1 \\
& &- &x_2 &- &2x_3 &+ &x_4 &= &1 \\
&x_1 &+ &2x_2 &+ &3x_3 &+ &x_4 &= &-2
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has many solutions depending on two parameters:
$$(x_3-3x_4,-1-2x_3+x_4, x_3, x_4), \, \forall x_3,x_4\in\mathbb{R}$$
answer3:
The system has many solutions depending on one parameter:
$$(1-3x_4,-1+x_4, 1, x_4), \, \forall x_4\in\mathbb{R}$$.

\end{cases}$$

answer3: The system has two solutions, $\left(-1,\,3,\,3\right)$ and $\left(2,\,1,\,0\right)$.
answer4: The system has an infinite number of solutions, which are of the form $\left(-4+z,\,z,\,z\right)$ for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.

question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system depending on the values of the parameters $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 3y & + & 6z & = & a \\ 
3x & + & y & + & 3z & = & 1 \\ 
6x & + & 6y & + & z & = & 1 \\
7x & + & 9y & + & 7z & = & b
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has no solutions for $b\neq a+1$. 

If $b=a+1$, then for every $a\in\mathbb{R}$ the system has $\left(\frac{37-14a}{100},\,\frac{3a-4}{20},\,\frac{1+3a}{25}\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer2: The system has no solution for every $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3:
If $b\neq a+1$, the system has no solutions. 

Otherwise, for every $a\in\mathbb{R}$ the system has $\left(\frac{3+3a-z}{2},\,\frac{2+a-2z}{2},\,z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4:
If $b=a+1$ the system has no solution. 

Otherwise, for every $a,b \in \mathbb{R}$ the system has a unique solution, which is $\left(\frac{a+b+1}{20},\,\frac{-a-b+2}{3},\,\frac{2a+3b-4}{15}\right)$.

Find the solutions of the following linear system depending on the values of the parameters $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 3y & + & 6z & = & a \\ 
3x & + & y & + & 3z & = & 1 \\ 
6x & + & 6y & + & z & = & 1 \\
7x & + & 9y & + & 7z & = & b
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has no solutions for $b\neq a+1$. 

If $b=a+1$, then for every $a\in\mathbb{R}$ the system has $\left(\frac{37-14a}{100},\,\frac{3a-4}{20},\,\frac{1+3a}{25}\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer2: The system has no solution for every $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3:
If $b\neq a+1$, the system has no solutions. 

Otherwise, for every $a\in\mathbb{R}$ the system has $\left(\frac{3+3a-z}{2},\,\frac{2+a-2z}{2},\,z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4:
If $b=a+1$ the system has no solution. 

Otherwise, for every $a,b \in \mathbb{R}$ the system has a unique solution, which is $\left(\frac{a+b+1}{20},\,\frac{-a-b+2}{3},\,\frac{2a+3b-4}{15}\right)$.

answer4: The $ABC$ plane has equation $2x+y+3=0$ and $D=(-1, -1, 0)$ belongs to $ABC$.

question: Find the conditional extrema of the function $f(x,y)=x^2+y^2-x-y$ having the constraint $x+y=1.$
answer1: The problem has the minimizer $\left(\frac{1}{2}, \frac{1}{2}\right),$ the minimum value of the function being $-\frac{1}{2}.$
answer2: There are two minimizers $\left(\frac{1}{4}, \frac{3}{4}\right)$ and $\left(\frac{3}{4},\frac{1}{4}\right)$ where the minimum value of the function is $-\frac{3}{8}.$
answer3: There are two maximizers $\left(\frac{2}{5}, \frac{3}{5}\right)$ and $\left(\frac{3}{5},\frac{2}{5}\right)$ where the maximum value of the function is $-\frac{12}{25}.$
answer4: The problem has no extrema corresponding to this constraint.

question:

$$\begin{cases}
&x_1 &- &x_2 &- &3x_3 &+ &4x_4 &= &1 \\
&x_1 &+ &x_2 &+ &x_3 &+ &2x_4 &= &-1 \\
& &- &x_2 &- &2x_3 &+ &x_4 &= &1 \\
&x_1 &+ &2x_2 &+ &3x_3 &+ &x_4 &= &-2
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has many solutions depending on two parameters:
$$(x_3-3x_4,-1-2x_3+x_4, x_3, x_4), \, \forall x_3,x_4\in\mathbb{R}$$
answer3:
The system has many solutions depending on one parameter:
$$(1-3x_4,-1+x_4, 1, x_4), \, \forall x_4\in\mathbb{R}$$.

question:

 & & y & + & 3z & = & 2 \\

\end{cases}$$

question:
Consider the vectors $u=(1, 3, 2)$, $v=(-1, 1, 2)$ and $w=(0, 1, 1)$ of $\mathbb{R}^3$ and the scalar triple product $u\cdot (v\times w)$. 
Choose the correct answer.
answer1: $u\cdot (v\times w) = 0$ and the vector $v \times w$ is normal to the vector $u$.
answer2: $u\cdot (v\times w) = (-1, 1, 1)$ and $u \times v$ and $w$ are coplanar vectors.
answer3: $u\cdot (v\times w) = 0$ and $u \times v$ and $w$ are coplanar vectors.
answer4: $u\cdot (v\times w) = 1$ and the vector $v \times w$ is normal to vector $u$.

answer3: There are two maximizers $\left(\frac{2}{5}, \frac{3}{5}\right)$ and $\left(\frac{3}{5},\frac{2}{5}\right)$ where the maximum value of the function is $-\frac{12}{25}.$
answer4: The problem has no extrema corresponding to this constraint.

question:
Construct the dual problem for the following problem:

\[\begin{array}{ll}
\text{Maximize} & Z= 2x_{1} + 7x_{2} + 4x_{3}\\
\text{subject to} & x_{1} + 2x_{2} + x_{3}\leq 10\\ 
& 3x_{1}+3x_{2}+2x_{3}\leq 10\\
& x_{1}, x_{2}, x_{3}\geq 0\\ 
\end{array}
\]
answer1:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Minimize} & W=10u_{1}+10u_{2}\\
			\text{subject to} & u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 2\\
			& 2u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 7\\
			& u_{1}+2u_{2}\geq 4\\
			& u_{1}, u_{2}\geq 0\\ 	
			\end{array}
			\]
answer2:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Minimize} & W=10u_{1}+10u_{2}\\
			\text{subject to} & u_{1}+3u_{2}\leq 2\\
			& 2u_{1}+3u_{2}\leq 7\\
			& u_{1}+2u_{2}\leq 4\\
			&  u_{1}, u_{2}\geq 0\\ 
			\end{array}
			\]
answer3:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Maximize} & W=10u_{1}+10u_{2}\\
			\text{subject to} &  u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 2\\
			& 2u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 7\\
			& u_{1}+2u_{2}\geq 4\\
			& u_{1}, u_{2}\geq 0\\ 
			\end{array}
			\]
answer4:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Minimize} & W=10u_{1}+u_{2}\\
	   	    \text{subject to} & u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 2\\
			& 2u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 7\\

			\]
answer4:

question:
Solve the problem to minimize and to maximize the objective function 
\[f:\mathbb{R}^{3}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}, f(x_{1},x_{2},x_{3})=x_{1}x_{2}x_{3} \]under the constraint 
\[x_{1}x_{2}+x_{1}x_{3}+x_{2}x_{3}-8=0.\]
answer1:
$f\left(  -\frac{2\sqrt{6}}{3},-\frac{2\sqrt{6}}{3},-\frac{2\sqrt{6}}{3}\right)$ is the minimum.
$f\left(  \frac{2\sqrt{6}}{3},\frac{2\sqrt{6}}{3},\frac{2\sqrt{6}}{3}\right)  \ $ is the maximum.
answer2:
$f\left(  -\frac{2\sqrt{6}}{3},-\frac{2\sqrt{6}}{3},-\frac{2\sqrt{6}}{3}\right)$ is the maximum.
 $f\left(  \frac{2\sqrt{6}}{3},\frac{2\sqrt{6}}{3},\frac{2\sqrt{6}}{3}\right)  \ $ is the minimum.
answer3: The fuction has no extremum points.
answer4:
$f(0,0,0)$ is the minimum.
$f(1,1,1)$ is the maximum.

question: Choose the true statement.

question: Which of the following is not a requirement for a goal programming problem?

How many solutions does the following linear system have, with respect to $a\in\mathbb{R}$?
$$\left\{\begin{array}{cccccccc}
ax & + & y & + & 2az & = & a+5\\
ax & - & ay & - & z & = & a\\
x & - & ay & + & z & = & 3
\end{array}\right.$$
answer1: One solution for $a\neq 1$, and no solutions for $a=1$.
answer2: One solution for $a\neq 1,-1$, no solutions for $a=1$ and infinitely many solutions for $a=-1$.
answer4: No solutions for $a\neq 0$, and one solution for $a=0$.

question: What can we say about the relative extrema of the function $f:(0,\infty) \times (0,\infty)\rightarrow \mathbb R$ given by $f(x,y)= x^2+xy+y^2-4\ln (x) -10\ln( y)+3$?
answer1: The point $M(2,1)$ is a relative minimizer.
answer2: The points $M(1,2)$ is a relative maximizer.
answer3: The point $M(2,1)$ is a relative maximizer.
answer4: The points $M(2,1)$ and $N(1,2)$ are relative minimizer and respectively, relative maximizer.

answer2: $\dfrac{\partial z}{\partial x}(x,y)=4x^5 e^{y^4}, \dfrac{\partial z}{\partial y}(x,y)=x^4 e^{y^5} y^4$
answer3: $\dfrac{\partial z}{\partial x}(x,y)=3x^3 e^{y^5}, \dfrac{\partial z}{\partial y}(x,y)=x^4 e^{y^5} 5y$

question: Consider the linear transformation $F:\mathbb{R}^2 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$, such that $F(x, y)=(x+2y, 2x+3y)$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(-3x+2y, 2x-y)$.
answer3: $F^{-1}$ is defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, -2x+y)$ and is not a symmetric operator.
answer4: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, 2x-y)$.

\end{array}

Find the general solution for the differential equation system

$\begin{cases}
x'(t)=2x+y \\
y'(t)=x+3y-z \\
z'(t)=-x+2y+3z
\end{cases}$
answer3:
$\begin{cases}
x(t)=C_{1}e^{2t}+C_{2}e^{3t}(2\cos (t)-\sin (t))+C_{3}e^{3t}(\cos (t)+2\sin (t))\\
y(t)=C_{2}e^{3t}(\cos (t)+3\sin (t))+C_{3}e^{3t}(3\cos (t)-\sin (t))\\
z(t)=C_{1}e^{2t}+2C_{2}e^{3t}\cos t+3C_{3}e^{3t}\sin t,
\end{cases}$
where $C_{1}, C_{2}, C_{3} \in \mathbb{R}$.
answer4:
$\begin{cases}
x(t)=C_{1}e^{2t}+C_{2}e^{t}(2\cos (t)-\sin (t))+C_{3}e^{t}(\cos (t)+2\sin (t))\\
y(t)=C_{2}e^{t}(\cos (t)-3\sin (t))+C_{3}e^{t}(3\cos (t)+\sin (t))\\
z(t)=C_{1}e^{2t}+5C_{2}e^{t}\cos (t)+5C_{3}e^{t}\sin (t),
\end{cases}$
where $C_{1}, C_{2}, C_{3} \in \mathbb{R}$.

question:
For which values of $a\in\mathbb{R}$ the following linear system has infinitely many solutions?
$$\left\{\begin{array}{cccccccc}
x & + & ay & + & 2z & = & 5\\
ax & - & y & - & z & = & 1\\
x &  + &  ay & + & z & = & 3
\end{array}\right.$$
answer1: There is no $a\in\mathbb{R}$ for which the system has infinitely many solutions.
answer4: For every $a\in\mathbb{R}$ the system has infinitely many solutions.

Find the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\ 
&-x &- &y &+ &2z &= &0 \\ 
&3x &- &y &- &5z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer3:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter:
$$(3+z,2-2z,z),\, \forall z\in \mathbb{R}$$.
answer4:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameter:
$$(3+z+y,y,z),\, \forall y,z\in \mathbb{R}$$.

question:
Find the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
&x_1 &- &x_2 &- &3x_3 &+ &4x_4 &= &1 \\
&x_1 &+ &x_2 &+ &x_3 &+ &2x_4 &= &-1 \\
& &- &x_2 &- &2x_3 &+ &x_4 &= &1 \\
&x_1 &+ &2x_2 &+ &3x_3 &+ &x_4 &= &-2
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has many solutions depending on two parameters:
$$(x_3-3x_4,-1-2x_3+x_4, x_3, x_4), \, \forall x_3,x_4\in\mathbb{R}$$
answer3:
The system has many solutions depending on one parameter:
$$(1-3x_4,-1+x_4, 1, x_4), \, \forall x_4\in\mathbb{R}$$.

Consider the following linear programming problem to determine the optimum production schedule concerning three products $x_1$, $x_2$ and $x_3$ to maximize the profit regarding Company XLK Lda. The production of these products requires resources 1 and 2. 

\[\begin{array}{ll}	
\text{Maximize} & Z= 3x_{1}+x_{2}+5x_{3}\\
\text{subject to} & 6x_{1}+3x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 45 \text{ (Resource 1)}\\
& 3x_{1}+4x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 30 \text{ (Resource 2)}\\
& x_{i}\geq 0, i=1~to~3\\	
\end{array}
\]	

Let $S_1$ and $S_2$ be the slack variables for the respective constraints. After we apply the simplex method, the final incomplete simplex tableau is:
\[
\begin{array}{l|ccccc|c}
& x_{1} & x_{2} & x_{3} &  S_{1} & S_{2} & \\
\hline
x_{1} & 1 & -1/3  & 0 &  1/3 & -1/3 & 5 \\
x_{3} & 0 & 1  & 1 &  -1/5 & 2/5 & 3 \\
\hline
& &   & &   & & \\
\end{array}
\]	
Find the allowable range for the total availability of resource 1 based on the final complete simplex tableau:

At the HealthPlus hospital, the nursing staff works in $6$ different shifts. Each shift has a duration of $8$ hours, with its start interval of $4$ hours (the first shift starts at $8:00$ AM, the second at $12:00$ AM, the third at $4:00$ p.m., and so on). The number of nurses required during the day is in the following table. How does the Linear Programming (LP) model should be formalized to allow planning the nursing staff, considering that $x_{i}$ is the number of nurses working in shift $i~(i = 1~to~6)$?

\[
\begin{array}{|l|c|}
\hline
\text{Day period} & \text{Required number of nurses} \\
\hline
\text{8:00 a.m. to 12:00 a.m.} & 140 \\
\text{12:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.} & 120 \\
\text{4:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m.} & 160 \\
\text{8:00 p.m. to 12:00 p.m.} & 90 \\
\text{12:00 p.m. to 4:00 a.m.} & 30 \\
\text{4:00 a.m. to 8:00 a.m.} & 60 \\
\hline
\end{array}
\]
answer2:
\[
		\begin{array}{ll}
		\text{Minimize} & Z= \sum_{i=1}^5 x_{i}\\			
		\text{subject to} & x_{1}+x_{2}\geq 120\\			
		& x_{2}+x_{3}\geq 160\\
		&x_{3}+x_{4}\geq 90\\
		&x_{4}+x_{5}\geq 30\\
		&x_{i}\geq 0, i=1~to~5\\ 
		\end{array}
	     \]
answer3:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Maximize} & Z= \sum_{i=1}^6 x_{i}\\
			\text{subject to} & x_{1}+x_{2}\geq 120\\
			& x_{2}+x_{3}\geq 160\\
			& x_{3}+x_{4}\geq 90\\
			& x_{4}+x_{5}\geq 30\\
			& x_{5}+x_{6}\geq 60\\
			& x_{i}\geq 0, i=1~to~6\\
			\end{array}
			\]
answer4:
\[\begin{array}{ll} 
				\text{Minimize} & Z= \sum_{i=1}^6 x_{i}\\			
			\text{subject to} &  x_{1}+x_{6}\geq 140\\			
			& x_{2}+x_{3}\geq 160\\			
			& x_{3}+x_{4}\geq 90\\			
			& x_{4}+x_{5}\geq 30\\			
			& x_{5}+x_{6}\geq 60\\
			\end{array}
			\]

question:
Consider the function $f:\mathbb{R}^{2} \rightarrow \mathbb{R}$ given by

$$f(x,y):=\begin{cases}
xy\dfrac{x^2-y^2}{x^2+y^2} & \text{if } (x,y)=(0,0) \\
0 & \text{if } (x,y) = (0,0)
\end{cases}$$

Calculate the second order derivatives at $(0,0)$ and establish if they are equal.
answer1: $1 = \dfrac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x \partial y}(0,0) \neq \dfrac{\partial^2 f}{\partial y \partial x}(0,0) = -1$.
answer2: $\dfrac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x \partial y}(0,0) = \dfrac{\partial^2 f}{\partial y \partial x}(0,0) = -1$.
answer3: $\dfrac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x \partial y}(0,0) = \dfrac{\partial^2 f}{\partial y \partial x}(0,0) = 1$.
answer4: $\dfrac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x \partial y}(0,0) = \dfrac{\partial^2 f}{\partial y \partial x}(0,0)=0$.

question:

2x & + & 3y & - & 5z & + & w & = & -3 \\
x & + & y & - & z & + & w & = & -2
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(z+w,\,z-w-1,\,z,\,w\right)$ as solution for all $z,w\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,2,\,2,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(x,\,y,\,x+y,\,x-y-1\right)$ as solution for all $x,y\in\mathbb{R}$.

$$\begin{cases}
x & - & y & - & z & = & 0 \\ 
x & + & jy & + & j^{2}z & = & a \\ 
 &  & j^{2}y & + & jz & = & b
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has no solutions if $a+b\neq 0$. 

If $b=-a$, then for every $a\in\mathbb{C}$ the system has $\left(\frac{a+(1+2j)z}{1+j},\,\frac{a+jz}{1+j},\,z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{C}$.
answer2: The system has no solution for every value of $a$ and $b$.
answer3: The system has $\left(0,0,0\right)$ as its unique solution if $a=b=0$, and for all other values of $a$ and $b$ the system has no solutions.
answer4: For every $a,b\in\mathbb{C}$ the system has $\left(\frac{a+(1+2j)z}{1+j},\,\frac{a+jz}{1+j},\,z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{C}$.

question:
For evaluating the lifespan of tyres of a particular brand, the distances (in km) driven before the tyres were worn out were recorded for a random sample of $100$ cars. 
The data was agregated in a frequency table shown below. Which statement is true? 

$\begin{array}{ |c|c|} 
\hline
\text{Kilometers}&\text{Frequency} \\ 
\hline
0 -30 000& 15\\ 
30 001 - 60 000 & 25\\ 
60 001 - 90 000 & 60\\ 
 \hline
\end{array}$
answer1: The sample range is at least $30 001$ but at most $90 000$.
answer3: The sample range is at least $30 000$ but  at most $90 000$.

2x & + & y & + & z & + & t & = & 0 \\

\end{cases}$$

question: Find the domain and the image of the function $f(x,y,z) = \frac{x+y+z}{|x+y+z|}$.
answer1:
The domain of $f$ consists of all points $(x,y,z)$ in space but not on the plane $x+y+z=0$.
The image of $f$ is the set $\{-1,1\}$.
answer2:
The domain of $f$ consists of all points $(x,y,z)$ in space but not on the plane $x+y+z=0$.
The image of $f$ is the interval $[\,-1,1]$.
answer3:
The domain of $f$ consists of all points $(x,y,z)\in \mathbb{R}^{3}\setminus \{(0,0,0) \}$.
The image of $f$ is the interval $[\,-1,1]$.
answer4:
The domain of $f$ consists of all points $(x,y,z)\in \mathbb{R}^{3}\setminus \{(0,0,0) \}$.
The image of $f$ is the set $\{-1,1\}$.

Consider the linear application $T:\mathbb{R}^2 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ such that $T(x,y)= \left(2x-y,3x+y\right)$. Choose the wrong answer.

Find the solutions $\left(\text{in } \mathbb{C}^2\right)$ of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
(1+i)z& + & (1-i)w & = & i \\
(1-i)z& + & (1+i)w & = & 1-i
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The unique solution of the linear system is $\bigg(\frac{3+i}{4},-\frac{1+i}{4}\bigg)$.
answer2: The solutions of the linear system are of the form $\bigg(\frac{1+i}{4},\frac{-1+i}{4}+z\bigg)$, for every $z\in\mathbb{C}$.
answer3: The linear system has no solutions.
answer4: The linear system has the vector $(i,-i)$ has its unique solution.

question: Choose the true statement.
answer1: If the kernel of a linear transformation $T:\mathbb{R}^3\longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^3$ is $\left\{(0,0,0)\right\}$, then $T$ is an isomorphism.
answer2: If the kernel of a linear transformation $T:\mathbb{R}^3\longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^4$ is $\left\{(0,0,0)\right\}$, then $T$ is an isomorphism.
answer3: If the kernel of a linear transformation $T:\mathbb{R}^2\longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^3$ is $\left\{(0,0)\right\}$, then $T$ is an isomorphism.
answer4: If the kernel of a linear transformation $T:\mathbb{R}^3\longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^3$ is $\left\{(0,0,x):x\in\mathbb{R}\right\}$, then $T$ is an isomorphism.

Find the solutions $\left(\text{in } \mathbb{R}^{2} \right)$ of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x &- &y &+ &z &+ &2t &= &2 \\
2x &+ &3y &+ &7z &+ &4t &= &-1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(1-2z-2t,\,-1-z,\,z,\,t\right)$ as solution for every $z,t\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1-2z,\,-1-z,\,z,\,0\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(1,-1,0,0\right)$ as its unique solution.

2x &  &  &+ &4z &= &0 \\

\end{cases}$$

answer3: The system has $\left(-4,3,2\right)$ as its unique solution.

question: A report of an insurance company stated that $79\%$ of children under age $16$ in a certain country were covered by a health insurance in $2013$. answer1: $50\%$ of the sampled observations had speed that was less than or equal to $7 m/s$.
answer2: The most frequently occurring wind speed in the sample was $7 m/s$.
answer3: $50\%$ of the sampled observations had speed that was equal to $7 m/s$.
answer4: $50\%$ of the sampled observations had speed that was less than or equal to $10 m/s$.

Find the solutions of the following linear system depending on the parameters $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$:
$$\begin{cases}
2x & + & y & + & 2z & = & a \\
x & + & 2y & + & z & = & b \\
x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\
4x & + & 3y & + & 4z & = & 0
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has solutions if and only if $a=-2$ and $b=5$. 
In this case, there is an infinite number of solution, which are of the form $\left(x,\,4,\,-3-x\right)$ for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer2:
The system has solutions if and only if $a \neq \frac{7}{4}$ and $b \neq \frac{5}{4}$.
In this case, the solutions are of the form $\left(\frac{3}{4}a-z,\,\frac{1}{4}b,\,z\right)$ for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3:
The system has solutions if and only if $a = \frac{7}{4}$ and $b = \frac{5}{4}$.
In this case, the unique solution is $\left(\frac{3}{4},\,\frac{1}{4},\,0\right)$.

Find the solutions of the following linear system depending on the values of the parameters $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$:
$$\begin{cases}
 &  & ay & + & az & = & ab \\ 
 &  &  &  & bz & = & a \\ 
x & + & y & + & z & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
If $a=b=0$, the system has $\left(x,\,y,\,1-x-y\right)$ as solution for every $x,y\in\mathbb{R}$.
If $a=0$ and $b\neq 0$, the system has $\left(x,\,1-x,\,0\right)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
If $a\neq 0$ and $b=0$, the system has no solutions. 
If $a,b\neq 0$, the system has $\left(1-b,\,\frac{b^{2}-a}{b},\,\frac{a}{b}\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer2:
The system has no solutions for $a\neq b$. 
If $a=b=0$, the system has $\left(x,\,y,\,1-x-y\right)$ as its solution for every $x,y\in\mathbb{R})$. 
If $a=b\neq 0$, the system has $\left(x,\,1-x,\,0\right)$ as its solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(b-a,\,b^{2}-a,\,\frac{b^{2}-a}{2a^{2}+1}\right)$ as its unique solution for every $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4:
If $a=b=0$, the system has $\left(x,\,y,\,1-x-y\right)$ as its solution for every $x,y\in\mathbb{R}^{2}$. 
If $a=0$ and $b\neq 0$, the system has no solutions.
If $a\neq 0$ and $b=0$, the system has $\left(x,\,0,\,x\right)$ as its solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
If $a,b\neq 0$, the system has $\left(x+a,\,y-\frac{b}{a},\,1-ax-by\right)$ as its solution for every $x,y\in\mathbb{R}$.

Find the solutions of the following linear system depending on the parameters $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$:
$$\begin{cases}
2x & + & y & + & 2z & = & a \\
x & + & 2y & + & z & = & b \\
x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\
4x & + & 3y & + & 4z & = & 0
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has solutions if and only if $a=-2$ and $b=5$. 
In this case, there is an infinite number of solution, which are of the form $\left(x,\,4,\,-3-x\right)$ for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer2:
The system has solutions if and only if $a \neq \frac{7}{4}$ and $b \neq \frac{5}{4}$.
In this case, the solutions are of the form $\left(\frac{3}{4}a-z,\,\frac{1}{4}b,\,z\right)$ for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3:
The system has solutions if and only if $a = \frac{7}{4}$ and $b = \frac{5}{4}$.
In this case, the unique solution is $\left(\frac{3}{4},\,\frac{1}{4},\,0\right)$.

At the HealthPlus hospital, the nursing staff works in $6$ different shifts. Each shift has a duration of $8$ hours, with its start interval of $4$ hours (the first shift starts at $8:00$ AM, the second at $12:00$ AM, the third at $4:00$ p.m., and so on). The number of nurses required during the day is in the following table. How does the Linear Programming (LP) model should be formalized to allow planning the nursing staff, considering that $x_{i}$ is the number of nurses working in shift $i~(i = 1~to~6)$?

\[
\begin{array}{|l|c|}
\hline
\text{Day period} & \text{Required number of nurses} \\
\hline
\text{8:00 a.m. to 12:00 a.m.} & 140 \\
\text{12:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.} & 120 \\
\text{4:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m.} & 160 \\
\text{8:00 p.m. to 12:00 p.m.} & 90 \\
\text{12:00 p.m. to 4:00 a.m.} & 30 \\
\text{4:00 a.m. to 8:00 a.m.} & 60 \\
\hline
\end{array}
\]
answer2:
\[
		\begin{array}{ll}
		\text{Minimize} & Z= \sum_{i=1}^5 x_{i}\\			
		\text{subject to} & x_{1}+x_{2}\geq 120\\			
		& x_{2}+x_{3}\geq 160\\
		&x_{3}+x_{4}\geq 90\\
		&x_{4}+x_{5}\geq 30\\
		&x_{i}\geq 0, i=1~to~5\\ 
		\end{array}
	     \]
answer3:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Maximize} & Z= \sum_{i=1}^6 x_{i}\\
			\text{subject to} & x_{1}+x_{2}\geq 120\\
			& x_{2}+x_{3}\geq 160\\
			& x_{3}+x_{4}\geq 90\\
			& x_{4}+x_{5}\geq 30\\
			& x_{5}+x_{6}\geq 60\\
			& x_{i}\geq 0, i=1~to~6\\
			\end{array}
			\]
answer4:
\[\begin{array}{ll} 
				\text{Minimize} & Z= \sum_{i=1}^6 x_{i}\\			
			\text{subject to} &  x_{1}+x_{6}\geq 140\\			
			& x_{2}+x_{3}\geq 160\\			
			& x_{3}+x_{4}\geq 90\\			
			& x_{4}+x_{5}\geq 30\\			
			& x_{5}+x_{6}\geq 60\\
			\end{array}
			\]

question: Consider the differentiable function $f:\mathbb{R}^{3}\rightarrow \mathbb{R}$, $f(x,y,z)=x^{2}yz-\cos \left( xyz\right) +xe^{yz}.$ Find $\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}.$
answer1:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(x,y,z)=2xyz+yz\sin \left( xyz\right) +e^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}(x,y,z)=x^{2}z+xz\sin \left( xyz\right) +xze^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(x,y,z)=x^{2}y+xy\sin \left( xyz\right) +xye^{yz}$
answer2:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(x,y,z)=2xyz-yz\sin \left( xyz\right) +e^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}(x,y,z)=x^{2}z-xz\sin \left( xyz\right) +xyze^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(x,y,z)=x^{2}y-xy\sin \left( xyz\right) +xye^{yz}$
answer3:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(x,y,z)=xyz+yz\sin \left( xyz\right) +e^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}(x,y,z)=x^{2}z+xz\sin \left( xyz\right) +xe^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(x,y,z)=x^{2}y+xy\sin \left( xyz\right) +xye^{yz}$
answer4:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(x,y,z)=xyz-yz\sin \left( xyz\right) +e^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}(x,y,z)=x^{2}z-xz\sin \left( xyz\right) +xze^{yz}$

$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(x,y,z)=x^{2}y-xy\sin \left( xyz\right) +xyze^{yz}$

question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system depending on the parameters $a,b,c\in\mathbb{R}$:
$$\begin{cases}
-x & + & y & + & z & = & a \\
&  & y & + & 3z & = & b \\
x &  &  & + & z & = & c
\end{cases}$$
answer1: For every value of $a,b,c\in\mathbb{R}$, the system has a unique solution, which is $\left(a-b+2c,\,3a-2b+3c,\,-a+b-c\right)$.
answer3:
The system has no solution for $a\neq 0$. 
If $a=0$ and for every value of $b,c\in\mathbb{R}$, the system has a unique solution, which is $\left(2c-b,\,3c-2b,\,b-c\right)$.
answer4: For every value of $a,b,c\in\mathbb{R}$, the system has $\left(1,\,1,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.

answer4: The common ratio is 4 and the general term is $u_n=n-4$.

\[
\begin{array}{|l|c|c|c|}
\hline
%& \multicolumn{2}{c|}{Grams of ingredient per serving} &\\

\hline
\text{Carbohydrates} & 5 & 15 & \geq 50 \\
\text{Protein} & 20 & 5 & \geq 40 \\
\text{Fat} & 15 & 2 & \leq 60 \\
\hline
\text{Cost per serving} & 4 & 2 &  \\
\hline

\]

question:
Consider the following linear programming problem to determine the optimum production schedule concerning three products $x_1$, $x_2$ and $x_3$ to maximize the profit regarding Company XLK Lda. The production of these products requires resources 1 and 2. 

\[\begin{array}{ll}	
\text{Maximize} & Z= 3x_{1}+x_{2}+5x_{3}\\
\text{subject to} & 6x_{1}+3x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 45 \text{ (Resource 1)}\\
& 3x_{1}+4x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 30 \text{ (Resource 2)}\\
& x_{i}\geq 0, i=1~to~3\\	
\end{array}
\]	

Let $S_1$ and $S_2$ be the slack variables for the respective constraints. After we apply the simplex method, the final incomplete simplex tableau is:

\[
\begin{array}{l|ccccc|c}
& x_{1} & x_{2} & x_{3} &  S_{1} & S_{2} & \\
\hline
x_{1} & 1 & -1/3  & 0 &  1/3 & -1/3 & 5 \\
x_{3} & 0 & 1  & 1 &  -1/5 & 2/5 & 3 \\
\hline
& &   & &   & & \\
\end{array}
\]	
Determine the solution if  the coefficient of $x_{1}$ in the objective function change to 2 u.m. based on the final complete simplex tableau.

Use the sample below to choose the correct statement.

$\begin{array}{ |c|c|} 
\hline
\text{Number of children}&\text{Frequency}  \\ 
\hline
0 & 10 \\
1 & 13 \\
2 & 24 \\
3 & 12 \\
4 & 8\\
5 & 2 \\
6 & 1 \\
\hline
\end{array}$
answer1: The lower quartile is $1$, the upper quartile is $3$, and the median is $2$.
answer2: The lower quartile is $0$, the upper quartile is $6$, and the median is $3$.
answer3: The lower quartile is $10$, the upper quartile is $1$, and the median is $12$.
answer4: The lower quartile is $1$, the upper quartile is $3$, and the median is $1$.

question:
How many solutions does the following linear system have, with respect to $a\in\mathbb{R}$?
$$\left\{\begin{array}{cccccccc}
ax & + & y & + & 2az & = & a+5\\
ax & - & ay & - & z & = & a\\
x & - & ay & + & z & = & 3
\end{array}\right.$$
answer1: One solution for $a\neq 1$, and no solutions for $a=1$.
answer2: One solution for $a\neq 1,-1$, no solutions for $a=1$ and infinitely many solutions for $a=-1$.

answer1: The integral curve that satisfies the initial condition is the curve $t-\frac{1}{2}t^{2}+x+\ln|x|=1$.
answer2: The integral curve that satisfies the initial condition is the curve $t-\frac{1}{2}t^{2}+x+\ln|x|=0$.
answer3: The integral curve that satisfies the initial condition is the curve $t-t^{2}+x+\ln|x|=1$.

question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
6x & - & 11y & + & 2z & - & 9t & = & 2 \\
2x & + & y & - & 2z & - & t & = & 1 \\
x & - & 3y & + & z & - & 2t & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(0,\,1,\,0,\,-1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(1+z,\,0,\,z,\,-z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(1-y,\,y,\,2+y,\,-y\right)$ as solution for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.

question:
Consider the following linear programming problem to determine the optimum production schedule concerning three products $x_1$, $x_2$ and $x_3$ to maximize the profit regarding Company XLK Lda. The production of these products requires resources 1 and 2. 

\[\begin{array}{ll}	
\text{Maximize} & Z= 3x_{1}+x_{2}+5x_{3}\\
\text{subject to} & 6x_{1}+3x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 45 \text{ (Resource 1)}\\
& 3x_{1}+4x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 30 \text{ (Resource 2)}\\
& x_{i}\geq 0, i=1~to~3\\	
\end{array}
\]

\end{array}

answer2: S1 is true, S2 is false
answer3: S1 is false, S2 is true
answer4: S1 and S2 are both false

question: Express $z=\operatorname{e}^{i3\pi}$ in the form $z=a+bi$.

The WorldLight Company produces two light fixtures (products $1$ and $2$) that require both metal frame parts and electrical components. Management wants to determine how many units of each product to produce so as to maximize profit. For each unit of product $1$, $1$ unit of frame parts and $2$ units of electrical components are required. For each unit of product $2$, $3$ units of frame parts and $2$ units of electrical components are required. The company has $200$ units of frame parts and $300$ units of electrical components. 

Each unit of product $1$ gives a profit of $1?$, and each unit of product $2$, up to $60$ units, gives a profit of $2?$. Any excess over	$60$ units of product $2$ brings no profit, so such excess has been ruled out.

How does the Linear Programming (LP) model should be formalized to allow planning of the company's activity?
answer1:
\[
\begin{array}{ll}
		\text{Maximize} & Z= x_{1} + 2x_{2}\\
		\text{subject to} & x_{1}+3x_{2}\leq 200\\
	        & 2x_{1}+2x_{2}\leq 300\\
			& x_{2}\leq 60\\
			&  x_{1},x_{2}\geq 0\\
\end{array}
\]
answer3:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
		\text{Minimize} & Z= x_{1} + 2x_{2}\\
			\text{subject to} & x_{1}+3x_{2}\leq 200\\
			    & 2x_{1}+2x_{2}\leq 300\\
			    & x_{2}\leq 60\\
			    & x_{1},x_{2}\geq 0\\
\end{array}
\]
answer4:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
		\text{Maximize} & Z= x_{1} + 2x_{2}\\
			\text{subject to} &  x_{1}+3x_{2}\leq 200\\
    			& 2x_{1}+2x_{2}\leq 300\\
			    & x_{2}\geq 60\\
			    & x_{1},x_{2}\geq 0\\
\end{array}
\]

question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system depending on the values of the parameters $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 3y & + & 6z & = & a \\ 
3x & + & y & + & 3z & = & 1 \\ 
6x & + & 6y & + & z & = & 1 \\
7x & + & 9y & + & 7z & = & b
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has no solutions for $b\neq a+1$. 

If $b=a+1$, then for every $a\in\mathbb{R}$ the system has $\left(\frac{37-14a}{100},\,\frac{3a-4}{20},\,\frac{1+3a}{25}\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer2: The system has no solution for every $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3:
If $b\neq a+1$, the system has no solutions. 

Otherwise, for every $a\in\mathbb{R}$ the system has $\left(\frac{3+3a-z}{2},\,\frac{2+a-2z}{2},\,z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4:
If $b=a+1$ the system has no solution. 

Otherwise, for every $a,b \in \mathbb{R}$ the system has a unique solution, which is $\left(\frac{a+b+1}{20},\,\frac{-a-b+2}{3},\,\frac{2a+3b-4}{15}\right)$.

answer3: The system has $\left(0,\,0,\,0,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(0,\,y,\,0,\,z\right)$ as solutions for every $y,z\in\mathbb{R}$.

answer3:

$$A_k=\left[\begin{array}{rrr}
 1  & 1  & 0 \\
  -1 & -k  & k-1 \\
  3 & 2  & 2k+1
\end{array}\right]$$
and denote by $L(A_k)$ the space of the rows of the matrix $A_k$. Which of the following statements is true?
answer1: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0, 1\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$
answer2: The dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$ for every $k\in \mathbb{R}$
answer3: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$
answer4: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0, -1\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$

Solve the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 2y & - & 3z & + & w & = & -2 \\
3x & - & y & - & 2z & - & 4w & = & 1 \\
2x & + & 3y & - & 5z & + & w & = & -3 \\
x & + & y & - & z & + & w & = & -2
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(z+w,\,z-w-1,\,z,\,w\right)$ as solution for all $z,w\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,2,\,2,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(x,\,y,\,x+y,\,x-y-1\right)$ as solution for all $x,y\in\mathbb{R}$.

question:
The local extrema of the function
\[
f:\mathbb{R}^{2}\rightarrow\mathbb{R},\text{ }f(x,y)=6x^{2}y+2y^{3}-45x-51y+7
\]
is:
answer1: $\left(  \frac{3}{2},\frac{5}{2}\right)  $ is a local minimizer and $\left(  -\frac{3}{2},-\frac{5}{2}\right)  $ is a local maximizer.
answer4: $\left(  \frac{3}{2},\frac{5}{2}\right)  $ is a local maximizer and $\left(  -\frac{3}{2},-\frac{5}{2}\right)  $ is a local minimizer.

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & - & y & + & 2z & = & 2 \\
3x & - & 2y & + & 3z & = & 0 \\
-x & + & y & - & z & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(-1,\,3,\,3\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has two solutions, $\left(-1,\,3,\,3\right)$ and $\left(2,\,1,\,0\right)$.
answer4: The system has an infinite number of solutions, which are of the form $\left(-4+z,\,z,\,z\right)$ for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.

question:
Find the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\ 
&-x &- &y &+ &2z &= &0 \\ 
&3x &- &y &- &5z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer3:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter:
$$(3+z,2-2z,z),\, \forall z\in \mathbb{R}$$.
answer4:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameter:
$$(3+z+y,y,z),\, \forall y,z\in \mathbb{R}$$.

question:
Find the solutions $\left(\text{in } \mathbb{C}^2\right)$ of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
(1+i)z& + & (1-i)w & = & i \\
(1-i)z& + & (1+i)w & = & 1-i
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The unique solution of the linear system is $\bigg(\frac{3+i}{4},-\frac{1+i}{4}\bigg)$.
answer2: The solutions of the linear system are of the form $\bigg(\frac{1+i}{4},\frac{-1+i}{4}+z\bigg)$, for every $z\in\mathbb{C}$.
answer3: The linear system has no solutions.
answer4: The linear system has the vector $(i,-i)$ has its unique solution.

question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system depending on the parameters $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$:
$$\begin{cases}
2x & + & y & + & 2z & = & a \\
x & + & 2y & + & z & = & b \\
x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\
4x & + & 3y & + & 4z & = & 0
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has solutions if and only if $a=-2$ and $b=5$. 
In this case, there is an infinite number of solution, which are of the form $\left(x,\,4,\,-3-x\right)$ for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer2:
The system has solutions if and only if $a \neq \frac{7}{4}$ and $b \neq \frac{5}{4}$.
In this case, the solutions are of the form $\left(\frac{3}{4}a-z,\,\frac{1}{4}b,\,z\right)$ for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3:
The system has solutions if and only if $a = \frac{7}{4}$ and $b = \frac{5}{4}$.
In this case, the unique solution is $\left(\frac{3}{4},\,\frac{1}{4},\,0\right)$.

answer3: $r$ has the direction of $v=\bigg(\dfrac{3}{2}, 1, 2\bigg)$ and contains the point $P=\bigg(\dfrac{1}{2}, 2, -3\bigg)$.
answer4: $r$ has the direction of $v=(3, -1, 2)$ and contains the point $P=(1, 2, -3)$.

\]

-2x & - & 2y & + & 3z & = & 0 \\
x & - & 3y & + & z & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has no solutions if $a \neq 1$ and $b \neq -1$.
If $a=1$ and $b=-1$, then the system has $\left(\frac{2+7z}{8},\,\frac{-2+5z}{8},\,z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.

Letting $j := e^{\frac{2i\pi}{3}}$, find the solutions of the following linear system depending on the values of the parameters $a,b\in\mathbb{C}$:
$$\begin{cases}
x & - & y & - & z & = & 0 \\ 
x & + & jy & + & j^{2}z & = & a \\ 
 &  & j^{2}y & + & jz & = & b
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has no solutions if $a+b\neq 0$. 

If $b=-a$, then for every $a\in\mathbb{C}$ the system has $\left(\frac{a+(1+2j)z}{1+j},\,\frac{a+jz}{1+j},\,z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{C}$.
answer2: The system has no solution for every value of $a$ and $b$.
answer3: The system has $\left(0,0,0\right)$ as its unique solution if $a=b=0$, and for all other values of $a$ and $b$ the system has no solutions.
answer4: For every $a,b\in\mathbb{C}$ the system has $\left(\frac{a+(1+2j)z}{1+j},\,\frac{a+jz}{1+j},\,z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{C}$.

question: Consider the bases $B=\left\{(2,1,-1),(-3,2,0),(0,-1,3)\right\}$ and $B'=\left\{(-1,0,2),(0,-3,0),(0,1,1)\right\}$ for $\mathbb{R}^3$. The transition matrix from $B$ to $B'$ is:

Find the solutions of the following linear system depending on the values of the parameters $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$:
$$\begin{cases}
ax & + & y & = & 1 \\ 
bx & + & y & = & 2 \\ 
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
If $b=a$, the system has no solution. 

If $b\neq a$, the system has $\left(\frac{1}{b-a},\,\frac{b-2a}{b-a}\right)$ as its unique solution
answer2: The system has no solutions for every $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3:
The system has no solutions if $a,b\neq 1$. 

If $a=b=1$, the system has $\left(x,\,\frac{x}{2}\right)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: For every $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$, the system has $\left(a-b+x,\,\frac{b-a+x}{2}\right)$ as its unique solution.

answer4: Every set of vectors that spans $\mathbb{R}^4$ is a basis for $\mathbb{R}^4$

question:
The spectral radius of the matrix $A = \begin{bmatrix}
2 & 0 & 0 \\
3 & -1 & 0 \\
0 & 4 & 3 \end{bmatrix}$ is:
Express $z=\pi \operatorname{e}^{-i\frac{\pi}{3}}$ in the form $z=a+bi$.

Consider the matrix 
$$A_k=\left[\begin{array}{rrr}
 1  & 1  & 0 \\
  -1 & -k  & k-1 \\
  3 & 2  & 2k+1
\end{array}\right]$$
and denote by $L(A_k)$ the space of the rows of the matrix $A_k$. Which of the following statements is true?
answer1: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0, 1\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$
answer2: The dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$ for every $k\in \mathbb{R}$
answer3: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$
answer4: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0, -1\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$

question: Consider in the three-dimensional cartesian system, the plane $\pi:2x+3y-z+5=0$ and the point $P=(-1, 2, 4)$. The distance from $P$ to $\pi$ is:

answer1: An equilateral triangle has 3 lines of symmetry.
answer2: An isosceles triangle has 2 lines of symmetry.
answer3: A scalene triangle has 1 line of symmetry.

A consulting firm will carry out two types of projects ($A$ and $B$). The development cost per project $A$ and $B$ is, respectively, $1$ and $2$ monetary units. The requirements in terms of analysts, programmers and terminals for each type of project are indicated in the following table:

\[
\begin{array}{|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
\text{Project} & \text{N. of programmers}  & \text{N. of analysts}  & \text{N. of terminals} \\
\hline
\text{A} & 2 & 2 & 3 \\
\text{B} & 3 & 6 & 1 \\
\hline
\end{array}
\]	

The company wants to minimize the cost of developing projects in the next period. In the development of these projects, at least $10$ programmers and $5$ analysts should be used while the company only has $6$ terminals available. How does the Linear Programming (LP) model should be formalized  to allow planning the company's activity?

answer1: X is the mean, Y is the median, and Z is the mode.
answer2: Y is the mean, Z is the median, and X is the mode.
answer3: Z is the mean, X is the median, and Y is the mode.
answer4: Z is the mean, Y is the median, and X is the mode.

question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system depending on the parameters $a,b,c\in\mathbb{R}$:
$$\begin{cases}
-x & + & y & + & z & = & a \\
&  & y & + & 3z & = & b \\
x &  &  & + & z & = & c
\end{cases}$$
answer1: For every value of $a,b,c\in\mathbb{R}$, the system has a unique solution, which is $\left(a-b+2c,\,3a-2b+3c,\,-a+b-c\right)$.
answer3:
The system has no solution for $a\neq 0$. 
If $a=0$ and for every value of $b,c\in\mathbb{R}$, the system has a unique solution, which is $\left(2c-b,\,3c-2b,\,b-c\right)$.
answer4: For every value of $a,b,c\in\mathbb{R}$, the system has $\left(1,\,1,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.

question:
Find the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
&x_1 &- &x_2 &- &3x_3 &+ &4x_4 &= &1 \\
&x_1 &+ &x_2 &+ &x_3 &+ &2x_4 &= &-1 \\
& &- &x_2 &- &2x_3 &+ &x_4 &= &1 \\
&x_1 &+ &2x_2 &+ &3x_3 &+ &x_4 &= &-2
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has many solutions depending on two parameters:
$$(x_3-3x_4,-1-2x_3+x_4, x_3, x_4), \, \forall x_3,x_4\in\mathbb{R}$$
answer3:
The system has many solutions depending on one parameter:
$$(1-3x_4,-1+x_4, 1, x_4), \, \forall x_4\in\mathbb{R}$$.
